Description: Canonical registry defining all semantic slots used by externalization templates. This registry is cumulative and append-only, supporting current and future template layers.

ASSERTION_CONTENT.Description: Primary assertion or claim being evaluated or referenced.

PROOF_REFERENCE.Description: Reference to a formal proof, derivation, or verification artifact.

PROOF_GAP.Description: Identifier describing a missing or incomplete proof element.

CONDITIONAL_STATEMENT.Description: Conditional expression whose satisfaction state is being evaluated.

PRECONDITION_VERIFICATION.Description: Verification evidence that required preconditions have been satisfied.

PRECONDITION_FAILURES.Description: List of unmet or failed preconditions.

PROOF_IDENTIFIER.Description: Canonical identifier for a proof artifact.

VALIDATION_PROCESS.Description: Process or method used to validate a proof or assertion.

COMPLETION_CRITERIA.Description: Conditions required to complete a validation process.

BOUNDARY_IDENTIFIER.Description: Identifier for a defined scope or boundary.

INCLUSION_CRITERIA.Description: Criteria defining what is included within a boundary.

EXCLUSION_CRITERIA.Description: Criteria defining what is excluded from a boundary.

OPERATION_IDENTIFIER.Description: Identifier for an operation or process.

VIOLATION_DETAILS.Description: Details describing how a boundary or constraint was violated.

DEPENDENCY_LIST.Description: List of dependencies required for an operation.

MISSING_DEPENDENCIES.Description: Dependencies that are missing or unavailable.

RESOLUTION_REQUIREMENTS.Description: Requirements necessary to resolve missing dependencies.

UNMET_PRECONDITIONS.Description: Preconditions that have not been met.

SATISFACTION_REQUIREMENTS.Description: Requirements needed to satisfy unmet preconditions.

CONSTRAINT_SCOPE.Description: Scope within which a constraint applies.

VIOLATION_DETECTION.Description: Method or signal used to detect a constraint violation.

REMEDIATION_ACTION.Description: Action required to remediate a violation.

AUDIT_TARGET.Description: Entity or artifact subject to audit.

IDENTIFYING_INFORMATION.Description: Information sufficient to uniquely identify an artifact.

ARTIFACT_LOCATION.Description: Location of an artifact within the system.

FACTUAL_SUBJECT.Description: Subject of a declarative factual statement.

EDUCATIONAL_SUBJECT.Description: Subject matter intended for instructional use.

EPISTEMIC_STATUS.Description: Certainty classification of the modified assertion, reflecting the upstream epistemic state.

CONFIDENCE_BASIS.Description: Reference to the basis for the stated confidence level, typically a proof status or grounding artifact.

RESTRICTION_SCOPE.Description: Scope boundary to which the modified assertion is restricted, as determined by the upstream meaning state.

RESTRICTION_BASIS.Description: Reference to the justification for scope restriction, typically a scope declaration or boundary artifact.

TEMPORAL_MARKER.Description: Temporal reference point indicating when the semantic state was resolved or established.

TEMPORAL_CONSTRAINT.Description: Conditions bounding the temporal validity of the rendered assertion.

STRENGTH_LEVEL.Description: Assertoric force classification: necessary, provisional, or indicated. Determined by SSC classification.

STRENGTH_BASIS.Description: Reference to the basis for strength modulation, typically a Semantic State Condition classification.

DEPENDENCY_CONDITION.Description: Dependency relationship on which the modified assertion is contingent.

DEPENDENCY_STATUS.Description: Current status of the stated dependency condition.

REMEDIATION_PATH.Description: Prescribed resolution path for a failure state, rendered without claiming resolution has occurred.

REMEDIATION_PRIORITY.Description: Priority classification for remediation, determined by the upstream governance state.

TEMPORAL_REFERENCE_POINT.Description: Temporal reference point for when the compiled semantic state was resolved (audit timestamp or equivalent marker). Used by CTX_TEMPORAL_COMPILED.

TEMPORAL_RESOLUTION_CONTEXT.Description: Temporal resolution context describing the establishment window or sequencing/audit context under which the statement was resolved. Used by CTX_TEMPORAL_COMPILED.

GROUNDING_BASIS.Description: Grounding basis descriptor for the compiled statement, traceable to Meaning_State_Reference grounding relations. Used by CTX_EPISTEMIC_COMPILED.

EVIDENTIAL_CHAIN.Description: Evidential/dependency chain descriptor supporting the compiled statement, traceable to Meaning_State_Reference and/or PXL_Formalization. Used by CTX_EPISTEMIC_COMPILED.

DOMAIN_IDENTIFIER.Description: Identifier naming the operational domain within which the compiled statement was produced (domain label). Used by CTX_DOMAIN_COMPILED.

DOMAIN_BOUNDARY.Description: Boundary descriptor stating the domain limits applicable to the compiled statement (declarative framing, not a restriction operator). Used by CTX_DOMAIN_COMPILED.

TRANSFORMATION_REFERENCE.Description: Reference identifier for the applied transformation/process that produced the compiled statement (Applied_Transformation_ID or equivalent). Used by CTX_OPERATIONAL_COMPILED.

TERMINATION_CONTEXT.Description: Sequencing termination status/context describing how resolution concluded (Sequencing_Termination_Reason). Used by CTX_OPERATIONAL_COMPILED.

Invariants: Slots are semantic interface points and must not encode logic
Registry is append-only; existing slots must not be modified or removed
All slot references in templates and manifests must resolve here
Slot names are canonical and case-sensitive
